pr_title: Report metrics with less copy and traverse

timeline.message: Report metrics with less copy and traverse

timeline.bodyText: This method will cover most of the should report metrics which is MetricKey with isClusterAggregated=true. But it does not cover those with ufs tags like Worker.BytesRead/WrittenPerUfs.UFS:<UFS_ADDRESS>.<worker_hostname>. The code here doesn't know information about any of the Alluxio UFS. That's why I added the method counterWithTags  and meterWithTags which will add those full metric name to the should report metrics set.
timeline.author: LuQQiu

timeline.bodyText:
I want to remove the logics of calling original allMetrics and allInstanceMetrics. These two methods do many full metrics traverse and do many metric copies which takes up a lot of the heap size.
METRIC_REGISTERY.getGauges(), getCounters(), getMeters(), getTimers() will internally traverse the MetricRegistry.metrics and make a copy of metrics belonging to the specific metric type.
Change to use  one METRIC_REGISTRY.getMetrics() will directly return the UnmodifiableSortedMap view of the original MetricRegistry.metrics map  which reduces four traverse of the MetricRegistry.metrics map  and reduce a full copy of the full metrics map.
timeline.author: LuQQiu

replies.bodyText:
Original report Metrics:  four traverse of full metrics, one copy of the full metrics, one copy of the worker or client metrics, one copy of the to be reported metrics.
Now report metrics: one traverse of the should report metrics, one copy of the to be reported metrics.
replies.author: LuQQiu

timeline.bodyText: Only report the should report metrics (MetricKey.isClusterAggregated == true, predefined) instead of reporting all the worker or client metrics. Reduce the amount of metrics worker reported and master stored.
timeline.author: LuQQiu

timeline.bodyText: Traverse the SHOULD_REPORT_METRICS instead of traverse all the metrics
timeline.author: LuQQiu

timeline.bodyText:
nit: this comment doesn't seem that clear to me.
Is this a better description?

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
              // Adds to make sure the SHOULD_REPORT_METRICS is initialized only once
          
          
            
            A flag telling whether metrics have been reported yet. Using this prevents us from initializing `SHOULD_REPORT_METRICS` more than once
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

replies.bodyText: Yeah, much better!! This functionality is cool!
replies.author: LuQQiu

timeline.bodyText: Can we optimize this arrayList allocation? do we know the number of metrics we're reporting at this point?
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

replies.bodyText:
For worker, 12 metrics we are reporting. But it's not guaranteed since we have Worker.BytesReadPerUfs.UFS:<UFS_ADDRESS>  and Worker.BytesReadPerUfs.UFS:<UFS_ADDRESS> which may have multiple metrics to report.
For client,  5 metrics to report.
replies.author: LuQQiu

timeline.bodyText: if this method returns null please annotate it with @Nullable
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

timeline.bodyText: I think you can use {@link #<variable_name>} to be more clear about "should report metrics"
timeline.author: ZacBlanco

timeline.message:
Apply suggestions from code review

Improve docs

Co-Authored-By: Zac Blanco <zac@alluxio.com>
